definition: to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: The butler turned and hurried into the house, slamming the door behind him.
sentences.chinese: 看门人拔脚朝屋里跑去，门在他身后砰的一声关上了。

sentences.english: As she was wonderful- she married a door-keeper coming from the country.
sentences.chinese: 由于她是个“骚货”，下嫁给一个墟落来的看门人。

sentences.english: “He was a janitor in a bowling alley, ” Haggis told me.
sentences.chinese: “他是一个保龄球馆看门人，”哈吉斯告诉我。

sentences.english: If you mention my name to the door-keeper he will let you in.
sentences.chinese: 你要是对看门人提我的名字，他会放你进去的。

sentences.english: The old caretaker was always scolding and chiding.
sentences.chinese: 这个老看门人总是责骂，呵叱个没完。

sentences.english: The porter distributes incoming letters to the offices.
sentences.chinese: 看门人向各个办公室分发来信。

sentences.english: The watchman just laughs at these stories.
sentences.chinese: 看门人尤里则对这些故事嗤之以鼻。

sentences.english: He fairly hustled around to the side entrance, and was let in by the friendly door-keeper.
sentences.chinese: 他急急绕到侧门，友好的看门人放他进了后台。

sentences.english: The janitor gets to explain why something went wrong.
sentences.chinese: 看门人需要解释为什么事情错了。

sentences.english: The interpreter accosted one old porter, and asked him if it were far to the Kremlin.
sentences.chinese: 翻译官向一个年老的看门人询问克里姆林还有多远？

sentences.english: He had an illusion when he entered the hotel that the gatekeeper was a detective.
sentences.chinese: 他进旅店时有一种幻觉，认为看门人是一个侦探。

sentences.english: However, one of our janitors has disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 但是，有一个看门人不见了。

sentences.english: He fairly hustled around to the side entrance and was let in by the friendly door-keeper .
sentences.chinese: 他急急绕到侧门，友好的看门人放他进了后台。

sentences.english: The gateman was a stodgy fellow of60.
sentences.chinese: 看门人是个六十岁的矮胖子。

sentences.english: If the superintendents had caught sight of them, they would have driven such rags forth.
sentences.chinese: 如果看门人发现了他们，一定要撵走这些小化子。

sentences.english: Then he went down stairs and woke up the porter.
sentences.chinese: 他随即走下楼去，叫醒那看门人。

definition: to keep goal/on duty as gatekeeper
to ensure public security/to ensure safety (for workers engaged in production)/public security/security guard
door/doorman (old)/hanger-on of an aristocrat/social influence/pull/classifier for relatives, marriages etc
